thread.title: Drone footage of New York's forgotten leper colon
thread.title_full: Drone footage of New York's forgotten leper colon

title: Drone footage of New York's forgotten leper colon
text: Incredible drone footage of New York's forgotten leper colony which has been closed to the public for 50 years North Brother Island has been closed to the public for more than fifty years Opened as a quarantine center in 1885, it was once home to hundreds of patients Most famous resident was 'Typhoid Mary' while scores of lepers were sent there The island, closed in 1963, is just 350 yards away from South Bronx, New York Drone footage captured the haunting labyrinth of crumbling ruins New York's parks department is considering granting 'limited' public access Published: 02:09 GMT, 1 February 2017 | Updated: 03:25 GMT, 1 February 2017 43 shares
